creator: okycastro@gmail.com
text:
scenario
User Parameters
  parm1 - ${__CSVRead(d:\subdata.txt,0)
  parm2 - ${__CSVRead(d:\subdata.txt,1)}${__CSVRead(d:\subdata.txt,next())}

subdata.txt
7877870166,D
7877870153,D
7877870119,D
7877870199,D
7877870096,H


parm2 will have D[SPACE]

TEMPORARY SOLUTION
Add a 3rd dummy parameter so that the space is added in that dummy parameter

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Works fine for me.

Are you sure that the data file does not have a space after the second parameter?

creator: okycastro@gmail.com
text:
I use logn to print the variable(something i did not do yesterday) and the space is not there. 

What I am doing with the data is creating a soap request. When I look  at the request being sent, the space is there. The space is NOT in the request I created in the test plan but it is in the request being sent. So I assumed the problem was in the reading because as soon I added the third dummy parameter, the space was gone. Now that the logn does not show the space, I have no more ideas how to help.  I know the problem is there.  This is the part of the request

<SimpleChar xsi:type="awsi:SimpleChar">${ptype}</SimpleChar>

as you can see , there is no space. 


I

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Please attach a simple test case that shows the SOAP problem.

Also include jmeter.log from a test run.

Replace any sensitive information before uploading any attachments!

creator: okycastro@gmail.com
text: I am changing this bug to invalid.  I just ran the program again, and I cannot reproduce it.  I wish I saved the request yesterday(sound like a visit to the mechanic). Now is not there.  I am sorry to waste your time.
